sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Gaussian elimination
message_1:
Solve the following system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method: 

2x + 3y - z = 5 
x - 2y + 4z = -6 
3x + y - 2z = 7
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using Gaussian elimination method, we will perform a series of row operations to transform the augmented matrix into its row-echelon form.

The augmented matrix for the given system is:

| 2  3 -1 |  5 |
| 1 -2  4 | -6 |
| 3  1 -2 |  7 |

Step 1: Swap Row 1 and Row 2 to have a 1 in the top-left corner:

| 1 -2  4 | -6 |
| 2  3 -1 |  5 |
| 3  1 -2 |  7 |

Step 2: Eliminate the 2 and 3 in the first column below the 1:

Row 2 = Row 2 - 2 * Row 1
Row 3 = Row 3 - 3 * Row 1

| 1 -2  4 | -6 |
| 0  7 -9 | 17 |
| 0  7 -14| 25 |

Step 3: Divide Row 2 by 7 to get a 1 in the second row and second column:

Row 2 = Row 2 / 7

| 1 -2  4 | -6 |
| 0  1 -9/7 | 17/7 |
| 0  7 -14| 25 |

Step 4: Eliminate the 7 in the third row and second column:

Row 3 = Row 3 - 7 * Row 2

| 1 -2  4 | -6 |
| 0  1 -9/7 | 17/7 |
| 0  0  1 |  4 |

Now we have the row-echelon form, and we can use back-substitution to find the solution.

From the third row, we have:
z = 4

From the second row, we have:
y - (9/7)z = 17/7
y - (9/7)(4) = 17/7
y = 17/7 + 36/7
y = 53/7

From the first row, we have:
x - 2y + 4z = -6
x - 2(53/7) + 4(4) = -6
x = -6 + 106/7 - 16
x = -22/7

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:
x = -22/7, y = 53/7, z = 4
